content.content: My love of charts, graphs, and analysis knows no bounds. And I get the feeling the same is true for most of us here! So I thought I’d run a top-line performance report looking at how makerdao.com is faring against some of the other names we are up against, Compound, Curve, and Aave. Let me know if you’d like to see any other brand comparision. READ IT HERE Happy weekend light reading!

Very Cool report Mamun! Certainly there are a lot of thing to improve in the web, that is why with the Maker Brand Team we plan to do a full revamp of it. The website is not being updated since Maker foundation times, so we have a lot of work to do!
MarianoDP:  we plan to do a full revamp of it.   Agreed! Like you said here, it’s taking a look at everything and improving on the limitations.
excellent, you can see the effort, the truth is a very good doc.
Amazing presentation of the analysis. It’s actually cool to see the traffic funnel and sources for the site.
Thanks Artem. We need really good analytics, understand on-site traffic funnel as well as off-site. Understanding how users navigate the MakerDAO ecosystem is extremely important
Thanks! Yeah, signed up to sourcecred. Glad you found the report  worthwhile.

As someone from a team working on an “alternative” frontend for MakerDAO, I really appreciate the suggestion that MakerDAO.com should be highlighting all available frontends, especially since there’s no official frontend maintained by any of the Core Units. Thank you for bringing that up @Mamun. @MarianoDP May I ask if this is something that’s being considered for the website revamp? Providing a brief comparison of available frontends/apps for managing Maker Vaults would certainly be much fairer to all teams that’ve been building on MakerDAO and providing different additional features and services. Liquity’s approach, for example, is much fairer, although still a bit lacking in good information for decision making.

Hi Jay, can I ask on what you mean by - an “alternative” fronted for MakerDAO, is it just like “makerdao.com” website or a frontend that communicates with Vaults and more? Cuz this is super interesting for us. Thanks!

I’m from the DeFi Saver team, but didn’t want to bring that up as a relevant argument, as I think all MakerDAO frontends (i.e. apps that support managing MakerDAO Vaults) should be mentioned in some capacity, without the DAO showing as much of a preference as is the case currently. To answer both sides of your questions - I don’t see a problem in having and keeping MakerDAO.com as the official starting point for introduction to the Maker protocol.

No problem at all. It makes sense to have easy access to feontends from MakerDAO and that’s also what analysis tells us. From conversations with @MarianoDP I believe this is already in the pipeline, If not it’s definitely something already been thought of.     nikola_j:  Liquity’s approach, for example, is much fairer, although still a bit lacking in good information for decision making.   This is an extremely important one, anything we design needs well thought out UI and in-depth UX analysis to make sure users are able to carry out intended actions easily using as little steps as possible.
